data.title: PLEXiDRIVE
data.description: Created extensive bash scripts to automate the process of uploading video media to a cloud provider (i.e. Google Drive) as a way to store Plex content

data.title: pyPatrol
data.description: A service monitoring node using Python and Sanic to monitor uptime of various services (ping, http responses, tcp sockets, steam game servers, and more!)

data.title: Warband Module
data.description: Custom Mount and Blade Warband module to run Warband servers within a Pterodactyl Game Panel. Supports 15 Warband mods!

data.title: Warband Banners
data.description: This little project scrapes stats of a running Mount and Blade Warband game server to populate a server banner to display within game forums, websites, etc. to show live server stats.

data.title: Holdfast Banners
data.description: This project stemmed from the Warband Banner Generator project and simply adapted it for Holdfast: Nations at War servers. This uses a Steam server query library for Python to get the live server stats.

data.title: TAK Server
data.description: While with the Air Force Research Laboratory, I converted the installation process of the Tactical Assault Kit (TAK) server (which is an Information Mgmt. server empowering Android Tactical Assault Kit [ATAK] clients) into an easy to use and rapidly deployable Docker container and bash scripts. This drastically cut down deployment and setup times to get soldiers connected on the battlefield.

data.title: LowEndStorage
data.description: This site compiles a sortable list of hosting providers, which offer ample amounts of storage space (250GB+) at dirt-cheap pricing. Most listed providers are active members of the LowEndTalk community.

data.title: Intern Project
data.description: As part of my internship with SafeNet Inc, along with a small group of interns, we examined the business' practices to identify a possible innovation. We then decided to recommend the company invest in a Business Process Management (BPM) tool. We analyzed and interview prospective vendors to find the best fit and did a business case analysis that determined an estimated 1 Million dollars could be saved annually in employees time.

data.title: Physics Phestival
data.description: This was a project for an educational game design course where we used the Phaser JavaScript-based game engine to create a game to help reinforce Physics concepts for a middle-school class in Chester, PA.

data.title: This Site
data.description: This site was first designed and crafted by Cassidy Williams and is a fork of her original site. With a couple of tweaks, I adapted the site for my needs (replacing a couple sections and fiddling with the JavaScript). The overall theme and feel were mostly kept intact.

data.title: Old Website
data.description: My old website (which replaced an even older website) which was aimed at creating a responsive and simple site to give a little information about myself.

data.title: Other Projects
data.description: Due to the nature of my line of work, there's many projects I've worked on that I cannot give details about. However, I have done extensive programming in: Python, Bash, C#, ASP.NET, Java, MATLAB, NodeJS, JavaScript, and more! And I've used many technologies including: Docker (+ compose), Swagger, ZeroMQ, PostgreSQL, WMTS, HPC, SQL Server, and many more!
